titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Avant-Garde Poetry Tape Recordings LSC.0961
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Manuscripts Division staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated on 2020 October 29.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-10-06 15:28:51 -0700.

did.abstract: Collection consists of 42 reel-to-reel tapes recorded by Michael Silverton for an avant-garde poetry series for New York radio station WNYC in 1966, and another for radio station WBAI in 1967.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This collection contains both processed and unprocessed audiovisual materials. Audiovisual materials are not currently available for access, unless otherwise noted in a Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the file level. All requests to access processed materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Avant-garde poetry tape recordings (Collection 961). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of 42 reel-to-reel tapes recorded by Michael Silverton for an avant-garde poetry series for New York radio station WNYC in 1966, and another for radio station WBAI in 1967. Interviewees include: Kenneth Koch, John Ashbery, Allan Kaplan, Jerome Rothenberg, Michael Benedikt, Russell Edson, Kenward Elmslie, Ted Berrigan, Joseph Ceravolo, Sotere Torregian, Lorenzo Thomas, John Perreault, Aram Saroyan, Jim Brodey, Peter Schjeedahl, Dick Gallup, Kathy Frazer, Tony Towle, Frank O'Hara (memorial), A. Schweiner, David Antin, Ted Greenwald, Lewis Warsh, Anne Waldman, Shelley Slater, Frank Kuenstler, Frank Lima, Gerald Hopman, Paul Blackburn, Joe Brainard, Stanley Moss, Michael O'Brien, Tom Clark, Ron Padgett, Don Gardner, Michael Brownstein, Milton Gilman, Robert Gilman, and Barton Midwood.

odd.head: Source of Description
odd.p: Description derived from in-house card file.

did.unittitle: Poetry of the Avant Garde series on WNYC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 19 open reel audiotapes recorded by Michael Silverton for a series of radio broadcasts entitled, Poetry of the Avant Garde.

Contents:
Reel 1: Kenneth Koch
Reel 2: John Ashbery
Reel 3: Allan Kaplan
Reel 4: Jerome Rothenberg
Reel 5: Michael Benedikt
Reel 6: Russell Edson
Reel 7: Kenward Elmslie
Reel 8: Ted Berrigan
Reel 9: Joseph Ceravolo
Reel 10: Sotere Torregian
Reel 11: Lorenzo Thomas
Reel 12: John Perreault
Reel 13: Aram Saroyan
Reel 14: Jim Brodey
Reel 15: Peter Schjeedahl
Reel 16: Dick Gallup
Reel 17: Kathy Frazer
Reel 18: Tony Towle
Reel 19: Frank O'Hara Memorial

did.unittitle: New York Poets series on WBAI

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 23 open reel audiotapes recorded by Michael Silverton for a series of broadcasts entitled, New York Poets.

Contents:
Reel 1 (10.5): A. Schweiner
Reel 2: Russell Edson
Reel 3: David Antin
Reel 4: Ted Greenwald
Reel 5: Lewis Warsh
Reel 6: Anne Waldman
Reel 7 (10.5): Shelley Slater
Reel 8: Frank Kuenstler
Reel 9: Frank Lima
Reel 10: Gerald Hopman
Reel 11: Paul Blackburn
Reel 12: Kenward Elmslie

Reel 18: Ron Padgett

Reel 22: Robert Kelly
Reel 23 (10.5): Barton Midwood
